ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend the course to fellow students who are eager to obtain a historical background on international affairs.

History 787 is a good introduction to a broad range of historians and there approach to international history. I would recommend this course to anyone who plans on specializing in western european history as well as political science and international relations.
Yes. It is a very good overview of how international history has been thought about since the fifth century BC.

Would strongly recommend. Provides good overview over the available literature in international history. Texts are read in a very chronological order. This could be improved and the readings aligned according to topic.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course exposed me to a broader range of historians and there approaches that I might not have had with most history courses. This course was did not touch upon my time period, but did give me some ideas of how to develop the theme that I have chosen.
Read relevant texts. Got exposed to new ideas in my research that were unknown to me before. Helpful use of and reference to historical methods and interconnections.
